content_text: Tense is the form of a verb that takes to show the time it happened. There are three main tenses: Past, Present, and Future.

Tense|Simple|Continuous|Perfect
Present|I eat.|I am eating.|I have eaten.
Past|I ate.|I was eating.|I had eaten.
Future|I will eat.|I will be eating.|I will have eaten.

graph LR
    A[Base Form: Eat] --> B{Time?}
    B -- Past --> C[Ate]
    B -- Present --> D[Eat/Eats]
    B -- Future --> E[Will Eat]
    C --> F[Completed Action]
    D --> G[Habitual Action]
    E --> H[Prediction]
I have finished my homework. (Action completed in the immediate past)
'I am knowing him' is incorrect. Stative verbs like 'know' are not used in continuous forms.
